section.title: Description
section.p: This class represents information about a person while in the role of a member of the United States Uniformed Services, which includes military and Public Health Service members.

stentry.p: A military, naval, or civil service rank
"Identifies the military rank/grade of the patient." - HL7 Version 2.8, PD1-20.
Possible values (from HL7 Table 141) include: E1...E9; O1...O9; W1...W4.

Indicates the latest known state of the USUniformedServicesPerson instance (i.e., the state of association (relationship) between the Person and the Uniformed Service). Possible values include: Active duty, Reservist, Discharged.
"This field is defined by CMS or other regulatory agencies." - HL7 Version 2.8, PD1-21. Possible values include (from HL7 Table 142): Active duty; Retired; Deceased.
An official position or grade; e.g., the rank of sergeant.
"Identifies the military rank/grade of the patient." - HL7 Version 2.8, PD1-20.
Possible values include: Sergeant, Captain, etc. Note that HL7 references a user-defined table (Table 141) which lists possible grades, but not the corresponding ranks.
Identifies the organization (uniformed service) for which the person holds a uniformed rank.
"This field is defined by CMS or other regulatory agencies." - HL7 Version 2.8, PD1-19.
Possible values include (from HL7 Table 140): US Army; US Navy; US Air Force; US Marine Corps; US Coast Guard; US Public Health Service; National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
